answerText: Goldich dissolution series[10] The results of the Goldich dissolution series resemble those of this series, which shows that certain minerals crystallize at certain temperatures as magma cools. This series, like the Goldich dissolution series, has both continuous and discontinuous branches at high temperatures.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | WUSTL A - Ottawa | 8 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This series shows that minerals with the most cations and ionic bonds in their structures are most susceptible to weathering. For 10 points each: [10] Name this series that shows that minerals formed at higher temperatures and pressures are more susceptible to weathering. It is named after its American formulator.
